must be in the viewâ€™s coordinate system.
The mouse-down event object from which to initiate the drag operation. In particular, its mouse location is used for the offset of the icon being dragged.
An object that serves as the controller of the dragging operation. It must conform to the
protocol and is typically the view itself or its
object.
The dragging session for the drag.
A basic drag starts by calling
The caller can take the returned
and continue to modify its properties. When the drag actually starts, the source is sent a
message followed by multiple
messages as the user drags.
Once the drag is ended or cancelled, the source receives a
method and the drag is complete.

abstract.text: Construct and manage a graphical, event-driven user interface for your macOS app.
A single dragged item within a dragging session.
The encapsulation of a drag-and-drop action that supports modification of the drag while in progress.
A set of methods that are implemented by the source object in a dragging session.
Invoked when the dragging session has completed.
Invoked when the drag moves on the screen.
Invoked when the drag will begin.
An object that contains information about an input action, such as a mouse click or a key press.
The infrastructure for drawing, printing, and handling events in an app.
Initiates a dragging session with a group of dragging items.
Initiates a dragging operation from the view, allowing the user to drag arbitrary data with a specified icon into any application that has window or view objects that accept dragged data.
Registers the pasteboard types that the view will accept as the destination of an image-dragging session.
The array of pasteboard drag types that the view can accept.
Allows the user to drag objects from the view without activating the app or moving the window of the view forward, possibly obscuring the destination.
Unregisters the view as a possible destination in a dragging session.
A window that an app displays on the screen.
A singleton actor whose executor is equivalent to the main dispatch queue.
